thread.title: Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation
thread.title_full: Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation
text:
Photo: Richard Drew, AP Image 1 of / 6   6 NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell, left, arrives during the National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The owners will further consider the desire of three franchises — the St. Louis Rams, Oakland Raiders and San Diego Chargers — to move to Los Angeles.
Photo: Richard Drew, AP NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell, left, arrives during the National... Image 2 of 6 New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft walks in a hallway during a break of the National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The owners are considering the desire of three franchises — the St. Louis Rams, Oakland Raiders and San Diego Chargers — to move to Los Angeles.
Photo: Richard Drew, AP New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft walks in a hallway during a... Image 3 of 6 Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones, and his daughter Charlotte Jones, confer during a break of the National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The owners are considering the desire of three franchises — the St. Louis Rams, Oakland Raiders and San Diego Chargers — to move to Los Angeles.
Photo: Richard Drew, AP Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones, and his daughter Charlotte Jones,... Image 4 of 6 FILE - In this Oct. 2, 2005 file photo, a fan wearing a sombrero blows a horn outside of the Azteca Stadium in Mexico City, Mexico, before the start of the first regular-season NFL game between the Arizona Cardinals and 49ers. On Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015, NFL owners approved more international games through 2025, including ones in places other than England, like Mexico and Germany.
Photo: Eduardo Verdugo, AP FILE - In this Oct. 2, 2005 file photo, a fan wearing a sombrero... Image 5 of 6 NFL Vice President International Mark Waller talks with reporters at the National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The league's owners approved more international games through 2025 on Wednesday, including ones in places other than England — possibly Mexico, Germany and Canada.
Photo: Richard Drew, AP NFL Vice President International Mark Waller talks with reporters... Image 6 of 6 St. Louis Rams owner Stan Kroenke walks in the hallway during a break of National Football League owners meeting, in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 7, 2015. The proposed riverfront stadium in St. Louis has a naming rights deal worth $158 million that hinges on the city having an NFL team when the facility opens.
Photo: Richard Drew, AP St. Louis Rams owner Stan Kroenke walks in the hallway during a... Goodell, owners expect future vote on LA relocation 1  /  6 Back to Gallery NEW YORK (AP) — Roger Goodell expects NFL owners will vote on franchise relocation to Los Angeles.
The league's commissioner said Wednesday the owners expressed interest "in wanting to be there, but also recognize we need to find solutions."
The St. Louis Rams , Oakland Raiders and San Diego Chargers all have designs on moving to LA, which has not had an NFL franchise since 1995, when the Rams and Raiders left. The current timetable calls for submission of applications to relocate in January, when the owners could vote.
Pittsburgh Steelers President Art Rooney said he doesn't envision that timetable being changed. He noted that St. Louis, Oakland and San Diego "still are putting together their proposals" to keep their teams.
The Rams are proposing a stadium in Inglewood, California, while the Raiders and Chargers have one planned for Carson.
